comment.author: 23800206@N02
comment._content: So clear as it was taken yesterday.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Taken on March 3, 1913, as the President-elect and First Lady Ellen Wilson (the first Mrs. Wilson) arrived in Washington, D. C., the day before the Inauguration. 

No First Lady participated in an inauguration ceremony until the precedent was set at Wilson's second inaugural, in March, 1917. (And in that year, it was his second wife, Edith Bolling Galt Wilson, who joined him in the carriage.)
